As the Wolfman, engages in a fierce, skillful werewolf vs. werewolf battle, uses agility to leap and swing from a chandelier to avoid heavy attacks.
Continues fighting Grey-Werewolf relentlessly, showing endurance and adaptability in a chaotic environment.
The Wolfman (Lawrence) skillfully dodges a huge stone hurled from a tower, quickly reacts by running and leaping, then starts climbing a tower despite imminent danger.
The Wolfman scrambles aside to avoid falling stones kicked loose by an adversary, showing alertness and agility.
No direct action or response shown by Lawrence in the burning Talbot House scene; only Gwen is seen reacting and calling for him, potentially indicating absence or inability to intervene.
Endures a brutal fight with the Grey-Werewolf despite severe injuries.
Appears unconscious and vulnerable after the tower collapse, failing to evade or counter the enemy.
Arrives at full speed to slam and fight Grey-Werewolf, saving Gwen from immediate harm.
Kills Grey-Werewolf by ripping his throat out, showing aggressive violence.
Circles Gwen threateningly after the fight, ignoring her pleas and identity, appearing as a predator rather than a protector.
Arrives at full speed and aggressively attacks Grey-Werewolf, overpowering and killing him.
Despite his violent action, he appears blood-drenched and driven by rage rather than composed strategy.
Circles Gwen menacingly, ignoring her pleas and identity, showing lack of self-control and reason.
For a moment, the Wolfman's ghastly features soften as he regards Gwen, showing a glimmer of recognition and the man trapped inside the beast resurfacing.
Suddenly rears back, howling in pain and anguish instead of attacking Gwen directly, then leaps away toward a cliff and falls, seemingly sacrificing himself.
Momentarily shows glimmer of recognition and softened features, hinting at internal conflict and awareness even in wolf form.
Charges Gwen aggressively and loses control, leaping impulsively off a cliff and falling into the river below, sustaining severe injuries.
